utterance: Maryellen Giger: Uh for the person who just joined, uh we're taking a minute to uh go through the topics and jot down a few ideas for discussion on our own.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: The speaker is explaining the current activity to someone who just joined the meeting, clarifying what 'we're taking a minute to do' means in this context.
annotations.assign task: The speaker is assigning the task of jotting down ideas for discussion to the team members.

utterance: Sandra Laney: Okay, that gives me a great opportunity to just say that I'm here as a butterfly on the wall as an observer. I'm from the a foundation and um I will actually be jumping off so no offense to anybody, but I have to jump off at at the top of the hour. Thanks.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: The speaker explains their role as 'a butterfly on the wall as an observer', clarifying their presence as a non-participating observer.
annotations.acknowledge contribution: The speaker is acknowledging the opportunity to speak, but not agreeing or expanding on any prior idea.
annotations.assign task: The speaker is assigning the task of understanding their limited participation to the team members.

annotations.express agreement: Maryellen expresses agreement with Sandra's statement about observing and leaving the meeting early.

utterance: Maryellen Giger: So I think that's about a minute. So hopefully you'll be able to jot some notes down and the next thing we want to do is do a brief introduction. For example, I will give you mine. I'm Mary Ellen Giger, I'm at the University of Chicago. My research is in biomedical engineering and I do this for medical reasons to develop new diagnostic but also in biology with cellular data to help um facilitate discoveries. Carolyn, can you introduce yourself? You got 30 seconds.

annotations.assign task: Maryellen assigns the task of introducing herself to Carolyn, directing her to speak next.
annotations.encourage participation: Maryellen encourages Carolyn to participate by asking her to introduce herself.
annotations.explain or define term or concept: Maryellen introduces herself as an example of the brief introduction she is requesting from others.

utterance: Carolyn Bayer: Yeah, I'm Carolyn Bayer. Um my research is in photoacoustic imaging. Um I'm at Tulane University. Um much of our work is focused on imaging the placenta for pregnancy and development. Um but nice meeting everyone.

annotations.explain or define term or concept: Carolyn is introducing herself and her research area, which involves explaining her field of study.
